Package docs

Detailed Description

@package xRender

This package generates a dataflow diagram from an INDS execution manager instance. The
code is broken up into
 - HTML/CGI (xRender.py)
 - INDS client interface (indsInterface.py)
 - Graph generator (dictToDot.py)
 - Routines to run the external 'dot' binary and handle tempfiles (dotMaker.py)
 - Read/write configuration file and determine operating system (osSpec.py)

@section Algorithm

1. Read INDS hostname from config file 'defaults.cfg'
2. Get XML config document from INDS
3. Compute MD5 hash of same. Compare to last saved hash in 'defaults.cfg'. 
If they match, return and do no work; the saved graph is current.
4. Fetch list of commands from INDS.
5. For each command:
  a. If transient, ignore (sleep, del)
  b. Otherwise, fetch the command type, nice name and XML snippet and store in
     an associative array keyed on the command id.
6. Once step 5 is complete, the dictToDot code iterates over the data several 
times to generate a dot-language graph. 
7. dotMaker takes the output from step six and invokes the external 'dot' binary
to produce an SVG (or PNG, PDF, etc) graph. This step is fragile due to the system
call, and I need to see if webdot could be used instead. Note that the dot binary and its
path are defined in 'defaults.cfg' to solve this.
8. dot outputs to ../../inds-svg/inds.svg

Generated on Tue Jan 27 11:01:34 2009 for xRenderforINDS by  1.5.8
